thread.title: Grandview firefighter jumps to safety after mayday in deadly bla
thread.title_full: Grandview firefighter jumps to safety after mayday in deadly bla - KCTV5

author: Chris Oberholtz, Multimedia Producer
title: Grandview firefighter jumps to safety after mayday in deadly bla
text:
GRANDVIEW, MO (KCTV) - A Grandview fire captain suffered second-degree burns after a making a mayday call while battling a deadly fire.
The fire broke out about 9:50 a.m. Monday near Main Street and Grandview Road.
When crews arrived on the scene, heavy fire and smoke could be seeing coming from the building. Firefighters heard people yelling for help and made entry through the front door, making their way to the apartments upstairs.
Crews managed to get three people out safely.
After firefighters were out of the building, they were going through the rest of the second-floor apartment when part of the roof collapsed, trapping firefighters. Those firefighters made their way out of a window to safety.
Refresh this page for updates.
